description:
Seriously, for a paid piece of software the included screenshots could actually show the application rather than sales-brochure statements of why it's so good.

If you want someone to buy something on a classically 'free' platform you sure as hell need to tell people what they are buying.
No issue about buying software that helps. But this is pretty basic. The standard web outlook.com interface is better. No contacts or calender page. That kills it for me.
I love to see nice new email clients that focus on productivity. I see what they're doing here, and it's coming along. Looking forward to revisiting it in 6 months or so.

Extremely slow. Clicking on a folder takes 5-10 second to load, every time you switch... even to the inbox with only10 emails in it. Other electron email apps load almost instantly. Very minimal options, not ideal for businesses or anyone who would use email every day.

It is beautiful and quite useful once you understand the features it has. It still needs to be polished in certain things, like: some paddings are missing in certain modals, tooltips don't always work and some other small kinks here & there. (Some of these kinks might be thanks to ElementaryOS, but still would be great looking into it.)

I manage all my communication with clients by using Mail Rules and Labels (just to make life easier as I get ~300 emails a week in 4 different accounts), so not having these features is a huge deal-breaker for me. I was excited to overuse the "Remind me on desktop" feature :'(

It's just not a great email application. Mailspring does everything it does for free, while looking better, and with a friendlier and more commonsensical interface. Newton's "supercharged" capabilities (namely read receipts, which I imagine are useful for some, integration with an AI scheduler, and 'undo send') all feel very dated. I can see why people made a big fuss about it when it came out but it just feels dusty now.

1 Hope login details not be hacked
2 After login, it comes 14 days trial just started
3 I do not recommend this, when E-mail itself not asking for money when you create it, then someone else not have right to push people to buy + share full details about login!
summary: E-mail app witches it scared users!

description: schade, die Software wäre nicht schlecht gewesen, wenn sie nicht gerade unfrei wäre. Kaufpflichtige Software solte nicht unbedingt in freier Software drin stecken.
La aplicación es buena descargela frutos Lovely :3
